metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1495 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Incorrect security UI in Downloads in Google Chrome on Android prior to101.0.4951.41 allowed a remote attacker to spoof the APK downloads dialogvia a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1495` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 101.0.4951.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 101.0.4951.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 101.0.4951.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 101.0.4951.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 101.0.4951.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '101.0.4951.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
